name: Kepler-228
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-228 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-228 is a star with 0.9620000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.01 times its radius. It is located 5624.89 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-228 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-228 b

Kepler-228 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.57 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-228.

The mass of Kepler-228 b is 2.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-228 b is 1.53 that of Earth. At 2.65 Earth masses, Kepler-228 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-228 c

Kepler-228 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.13 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-228.

The mass of Kepler-228 c is 10.45 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-228 c is 2.7 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-228 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-228 d

Kepler-228 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-228.

The mass of Kepler-228 d is 27.37 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-228 d is 4.04 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-228 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-228, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
